column5: Just heard on the news actor/comedian robin Williams was found in his home dead in an apparent suicide !!!! That's too bad for sure .... He was a funny man I'm sure there will be more details as the media is all over this
Sad indead, he was one of my favorite actors!
Sad news...I remember Robin Williams on Johnny Carson back in the early nineties, hilarious.
WOW Thats so sad.  He again another gone to early. We all see the funny man on the outside,but dont know whats going on in the inside.  RIP MORK.

Depression...serious illness. Very very sad to have the whole world see you as such a star and not be able to beat depression.  Such a brilliant actor and comedian. My favourite was Mrs.Doubtfire but remember watching Mork and Mindy and loved his stand up on golf.  May he rest in peace.
One of the greats of our time.
This is very sad  It somewhat reminds me of when John Lennon was taken unexpectedly ....the very best in the world at what they do....and then gone in a blink

Depression...serious illness. Very very sad to have the whole world see you as such a star and not be able to beat depression.  Such a brilliant actor and comedian. My favourite was Mrs.Doubtfire but remember watching Mork and Mindy and loved his stand up on golf.  May he rest in peace. x2
Very sad...  The more I think about it the more memories I find attached to his movies....  I just watched jumanji the other day...  Amazing talent lost...
For me I think Patch Adams was one of his best roles.  Dan.
Dead Poets Society completely changed the way I looked at Robin.  "Oh Captain! My Captain!"
The saying " Money can't buy you happiness " comes to mind.  His stand up when he explains Golf is the best I ever saw. " How many times do you have to do this?" 18 F'n times!!!!!!!!
I loved his performance in Good Will Hunting.. One of the best!  He'll be missed.
Agreed, one of my all time favourites! Lost another amazing person. R.I.P.

Unexpected for sure,as old ironmaker said,all the money in the world is not the only thing.Finding out his alcohol and drug habits were stopped years ago. Can't imagine with the help today what he was holding onto inside,that let's you make this final decision .Far to sad,one of my favorites,rip Sir!!!

The saying " Money can't buy you happiness " comes to mind.  His stand up when he explains Golf is the best I ever saw. " How many times do you have to do this?" 18 Damn times!!!!!!!!   Yes I have to agree. The best.   PG  HERE FOLKS. DONT CLICK IF KIDDIES AROUND.
he was one of the funniest, most talented of a generation, and its unlikely we will see someone with his range of talents again. Thanks for the laughs Robin and may you find peace at last.

Very sad, I grew up watching his movies and his stand up was second to none. A brilliant mind coupled with charisma and wit. It was mentioned today on the news that he was beginning to suffer from the early stages of Parkinsons.

Very sad, I grew up watching his movies and his stand up was second to none. A brilliant mind coupled with charisma and wit. It was mentioned today on the news that he was beginning to suffer from the early stages of Parkinsons. Heard that today Pete,his wife offered that part from what I understand. Will miss him as well,quite the talented guy for sure!

I was away last week vacationing in Allegany State Park when I heard, thought at first it was a joke!? I can't believe how sad this makes me, I feel like I lost a friend...Though I've never met the man I've been a fan since childhood watching M&M...The world will be a lessor place now that Robin is no longer with us!
That was great Pidge
Mork and Mindy is so vivid in my mind!
